thread.title: EastEnders promo trailers for its bonkers plots are now so much better than the actual soap
thread.title_full: EastEnders promo trailers for its bonkers plots are now so much better than the actual soap

author: Ian Hyland
title: EastEnders promo trailers for its bonkers plots are now so much better than the actual soap
text:
TV Opinion EastEnders promo trailers for its bonkers plots are now so much better than the actual soap Michelle Fowler has embarked on an age-gap romance but it's challenging viewers ability to stay awake, says Mirror TV columnist Ian Hyland Share Some of the comments in EastEnders were hilarious (Photo: BBC) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Okay, I’ll admit it. EastEnders has made me belly laugh twice this week already. 
And I was actually laughing WITH not AT it. First up, the timing and delivery of Kim’s response to Denise quoting Jane Eyre on Monday was superb: “Jane Eyre ain’t gonna help you pay no bills.” 
Then one of the team names at the pub quiz was so puntastic it almost winded me: The Quiz Akabusis. 
Unfortunately, once I’d got my breath back I turned to the enemy of scriptwriters everywhere: Google search. 
Now, I’m not saying the writers definitely used the Pub Quiz Team Name Generator online tool.10070668 
I do however have a feeling they’ve been hitting the Random Soap Storyline Generator button pretty hard lately. Read More EastEnders viewers warned to brace themselves as dramatic teaser shows Michelle and Preston's shameful affair exposed Michelle Fowler and her age-gap lover, Preston (Photo: BBC) 
There can be no other explanation for the age-gap romance between Michelle Fowler Mk II - who is nothing at all like Michelle Fowler Mk I - and her American toy boy Preston, who appears to thinks he’s in Goodfellas or an early Elvis Presley movie. 
Weirdly, the BBC is so pleased with itself it has afforded this bonkers storyline one of those glossy promo trailers that always look so much better than EastEnders ever is. 
Of course, I can’t stop the production crew saluting their bravery for challenging prejudices (which I'm not sure even exist). 
I just feel someone should alert them to the fact the only thing this storyline is actually challenging is the viewer’s ability to stay awake. 
Honestly, it’s so bad that at times the only thing keeping me going is the prospect of another update from Carmel on the bin collection situation. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
